entry.title: Re: Report for PR's with attachments
entry.content:
There is no standard SAP report to list Purchase Requisitions (PRs) with attachments.

If attachments are added via Generic Object Services (GOS), you can identify PRs with attachments using table SRGBTBREL:

  • RELTYPE = ATTA

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2105 (Purchase Requisition)

  • INSTID_A = PR number (with leading zeros)

This table stores the relationship between the PR and its attachments.
You can build a custom report (or SE16N query) based on SRGBTBREL and join with EBAN to display PR details.

If attachments were added via DMS, then tables like DRAW / DRAD may be relevant, but for GOS attachments SRGBTBREL is the correct and recommended approach.

entry.title: Re: attachment in maintenance orders
entry.content:
If the attachment is added via Services for Object (GOS) in a maintenance order, it is stored as a GOS relationship.

You can identify maintenance orders with attachments using table SRGBTBREL with:

  • RELTYPE = 'ATTA'

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2007 (PM Order)

  • INSTID_A = Order Number

The actual document metadata/content is linked via SOOD / SOFM / SOFF* tables.

There is no standard indicator or report in PM orders to show attachments.
If you need a visual indicator or reporting:

  • Create a custom report reading SRGBTBREL

  • Or set a user status at save using user-exit IWO10009 when attachments exist (commonly used approach)

entry.title: Re: SD Archiving - archive attachment of SD documents
entry.content:
Hi Kalyan,

Good questions üëç
Short answer: the procedure described in the blog applies only to SAPoffice / GOS attachments, not to all attachment types.

Here is the breakdown:

1. GOS / SAPoffice attachments (SOOD / SOFM / SOC3)
‚úî Yes, these are covered by SD_VBAK with ‚ÄúArchive Attachments‚Äù flag
‚úî Post‚Äëprocessing with RSBCS_REORG is required to clean up SOOD / SOC3
‚úî This is exactly what the blog explains

2. ArchiveLink attachments (OAC, TOA0x tables)*
‚ùåNot handled by SD_VBAK
‚úî These are archived via ArchiveLink customizing + Content Server
‚úî Deletion is controlled by:

  • ArchiveLink retention rules

  • Archiving object of the business document (e.g. SD_VBAK)

  • Content repository settings (OAC0 / OAC3)

You must ensure the link entries (TOA01, TOA02, ‚Ä¶) are deleted by the application archiving object and the physical document is removed by the content server.

3. KPRO / DMS attachments (tables like DMS, KPRO, links via SRGBTBREL)*
‚ùåNot archived by SD_VBAK
‚úî These follow DMS archiving objects (e.g. DMS_DOC)
‚úî Relationship entries in SRGBTBREL may remain if the document itself is still retained

4. BRF+ / Output attachments (SFORM_A_STORAGE)
‚ùåNot part of SD_VBAK
‚úî Archived via Output Management / BRF+ specific cleanup reports
‚úî Retention depends on output framework configuration and application logs

5. Guide for SD_VBAK
Best references are:

  • SAP Note 2940339 ‚Äì Archiving of attachments in SD

  • Transaction AOBJ / ACLA (check class SGOS, SBCS)

  • SAP Help Portal for Data Archiving in S/4HANA SD

Summary:
SD_VBAK only archives GOS/SAPoffice attachments.
Other attachment types (ArchiveLink, DMS/KPRO, BRF+) must be handled by their own archiving concepts.

Hope this clarifies the scope.

Regards,
Juveria

entry.title: Re: Need to find table for dispute case attachments in se...
entry.content:
GOS attachments are stored via the Generic Object Services framework.
The link between the business object and the attachment is maintained in SRGBTBREL.
Actual document content is stored in SOOD / SOFM / SOFFCONT1 (or on a content server).
You can retrieve attachments programmatically using BDS_GOS_CONNECTIONS_GET or CL_GOS_MANAGER.
There is no standard report; a custom report is required.

entry.title: Re: OK (aRs?)- next question is on URL's from BAPI_REL_GE...
entry.content:
For GOS URL attachments, the actual HTTP URL is not stored directly in SRGBTBREL.
You need to read the linked SAPoffice document.

Use FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 and pass DOCUMENT_ID = SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B.
The URL is stored in the returned OBJECT_CONTENT (usually as plain text containing the full HTTP/HTTPS link).

This is the standard way to retrieve URLs created via Services for Object (GOS).

entry.title: Re: where the attached files stores in SAP table
entry.content:
In SAP 4.6C, GOS framework is not fully available, so table SRGBTBREL does not exist.
Attachments in FB03 are stored via SAPoffice:

  • SOOD / SOFM / SOC3 ‚Üí document metadata and content

  • Link to FI document is handled internally via SAPoffice objects (not via SRGBTBREL)

From ECC 5.0 / 6.0 onward, GOS is used and links are stored in SRGBTBREL (with TYPEID_A = BKPF/BSEG).

So for 4.6C, check SOOD/SOFM, not SRGBTBREL.

entry.title: Re: Read data from attachment List
entry.content:
Nice and clear explanation üëç
Using SRGBTBREL together with SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 is very helpful for reading notes from the GOS attachment list, especially for FI documents and Fiori scenarios. Thanks for sharing the step-by-step approach and sample code.

entry.title: Re: How to copy GOS attachments from main document(FB03)...
entry.content:
This is not a GOS (SRGBTBREL) case but an ArchiveLink scenario.

If attachments exist only in TOA01, they are ArchiveLink documents. To copy attachments from the original FI document (FB03) to the reversal document (FB08), you must use ArchiveLink APIs, not GOS logic.

Approach:

  1. Read existing ArchiveLink connections of the original document using TOA01 / ArchiveLink function modules.

  2. Create new ArchiveLink links for the reversal document with the same archive document IDs.

  3. Standard ArchiveLink FMs/classes (e.g. ARCHIV_GET_CONNECTIONS / ARCHIV_CONNECTION_INSERT) can be used.

Since there are no SRGBTBREL entries, GOS is not involved here.

entry.title: Re: Sending Attachments of RFQ in Mail
entry.content:
In standard SAP, GOS attachments added to RFQs (ME42 ‚Üí Services for Object) are not included automatically in output emails (NEU, external send). This requires custom development.

You can fetch the attachment via table SRGBTBREL using the RFQ number in INSTID_A, read the document ID from INSTID_B, and then use FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 to retrieve the file and attach it manually to the email.

SAP Note 1296758 (PO attachments via mail) describes the same approach, which also applies to RFQs.

entry.title: Re: Check Invoice posted without attachment
entry.content:
There is no standard SAP report to list invoices posted without attachments.

For FI documents, GOS attachments are stored via SRGBTBREL:

  • TYPEID_A = 'BKPF' ‚Üí header-level attachment

  • TYPEID_A = 'BSEG' ‚Üí line-item attachment

  • INSTID_A = Company Code + Document Number + Fiscal Year

To find invoices without attachments, create a custom report:

  1. Select accounting documents from BKPF (based on company code, posting date, document type, etc.).

  2. Left outer join with SRGBTBREL on object type (BKPF/BSEG) and instance ID.

  3. Documents with no matching entry in SRGBTBREL are invoices posted without attachments.

Standard reports like FB03 / FBL1N cannot directly identify missing attachments.

entry.title: Re: If I attach a document to Work Permit (WCA), in which...
entry.content:
If the document is attached via GOS (Services for Object), the linkage is stored in SRGBTBREL (use RELTYPE = 'ATTA' and TYPEID_A = 'WCA').
If the attachment is via DMS, check DRAD with DOKOB = 'WCAAP'.
You can build a report by joining these tables to list WCA vs attached document names.

entry.title: Re: attachment filename in PM ORDER
entry.content:
For PM orders, GOS attachments are only linked in SRGBTBREL (relationship table).
The filename is not stored there.

To get the filename:

  • For GOS/SAPoffice attachments:
    Use SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B and read document details via SOOD / SOFM or FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 (field OBJ_DESCR / FILE_NAME).

  • For ArchiveLink attachments:
    Check TOA01 and then read metadata from the ArchiveLink repository (configured via OAM1).

So the filename depends on the attachment type (GOS vs ArchiveLink) and must be read from the corresponding storage tables, not from SRGBTBREL directly.

entry.title: Re: Bot√≥n Servicios para Objetos de los objetos SAP
entry.content:
Para los adjuntos GOS, la tabla SRGBTBREL solo guarda la relaci√≥n con el objeto, no el contenido ni el tama√±o.

El tama√±o (bytes) del adjunto se obtiene en las tablas de SAPoffice:

  • SOFM ‚Üí campo DOC_SIZE

  • Relaci√≥n:

    • SRGBTBREL-INSTID_B = documento SAPoffice

    • SOFM-DOCYR = SOOD-OBJYR

    • SOFM-DOCNO = SOOD-OBJNO

Alternativamente, se puede obtener v√≠a FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1, que devuelve metadatos y contenido del documento.

entry.title: Re: Attachment list to PM orders
entry.content:
There is no standard transaction to view GOS (Services for Objects) attachments for multiple PM orders at once.
To get this information, you need a custom report.

GOS attachments are stored via table SRGBTBREL (use TYPEID_A = BUS2007 for PM orders and INSTID_A = AUFNR).
To get attachment details like creator and filename, join SRGBTBREL with SOOD / SOFM (using INSTID_B ‚Üí OBJTP/OBJYR/OBJNO).

Attachment content can be read using FM SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 or SO_OBJECT_GET_CONTENT.

entry.title: Re: Data Migration from SOFTCONT tables
entry.content:
You can identify and extract customer master attachments created via GOS using table SRGBTBREL.

  • Use TYPEID_A = KNA1 / KNB1

  • Use INSTID_A = Customer Number

This gives you all attachments linked to selected customers.
To read the actual documents, use standard content server FMs such as SCMS_DOC_INFO, SCMS_AO_FILE_GET, or SCMS_AO_TABLE_GET.
The same GOS framework can be used in the target system to re‚Äëattach the documents.

entry.title: Re: Sending mail with workflow functionality
entry.content:
Hi,
Attachments stored via GOS are linked in SRGBTBREL and the document content is stored in SOOD / SOFM.
You can first read the document using SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1 or SO_OBJECT_READ, and then send the email with attachment using SO_NEW_DOCUMENT_ATT_SEND_API1.
This is the standard approach to send emails with attachments stored in SAPoffice tables.

Regards.

entry.title: Re: Table to store Vendor master attachment
entry.content:
Vendor master attachments created via GOS (Services for Objects) are stored via object links in table SRGBTBREL.
Use TYPEID_A = LFA1 (or KRED depending on release) and INSTID_A = Vendor number to identify the attachments.
The actual document metadata/content can be found in SOOD / SOFM / SOC3 using INSTID_B from SRGBTBREL.

entry.title: Re: Attachment List FM or Report in QM notification
entry.content:
There is no standard FM or report in SAP to track deleted GOS attachments for QM notifications.
GOS attachments are indexed in SRGBTBREL, but once an attachment is deleted, the entry is physically removed and no deletion log is kept.

If audit history is required, the options are:
‚Ä¢ Enable table audit logging (via Basis) for SRGBTBREL / SAPoffice tables
‚Ä¢ Create a custom snapshot/compare program to track daily changes
‚Ä¢ Implement a GOS BAdI / enhancement to log create/delete events

Standard SAP does not provide deletion indicators for GOS attachments.

entry.title: Re: RSBCS_REORG to delete records from Table SOFFCONT1
entry.content:
RSBCS_REORG does not directly delete SOFFCONT1 rows line‚Äëby‚Äëline in the report logic. The deletion is handled via BCS/KPro cleanup.
To effectively reduce SOFFCONT1, SAP recommends running the full cleanup sequence:

  1. RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE (delete documents in user folders)

  2. RSSODFRE (clean up folders / hidden folders)

  3. RSBCS_REORG (BCS reorganization)

After this, SOFFCONT1 row count and data size decrease (unused space increases), which can be verified via DBACOCKPIT ‚Üí Single Table Analysis.
See SAP Notes 1641830, 1634908, and 567975 for the complete procedure.

entry.title: Re: Service for Object
entry.content:
‚ÄúService for Objects (GOS) does not use a single table.
The main tables involved are:

  • SRGBTBREL ‚Äì stores the relationship between business object and attachment

  • SOOD / SOFM ‚Äì SAPoffice document metadata

  • SOC3 / SOFFCONT1 ‚Äì attachment content storage

The business object can be identified using TYPEID_A and INSTID_A in SRGBTBREL.‚Äù

entry.title: Re: Delete unlinked files from Content Server
entry.content:
When GOS attachments are stored via KPro / Content Server (SOFFDB), deleting them from GOS only removes the link (SRGBTBREL). The LOIO/PHIO remains in KPro, so the file stays in the Content Server.

To clean up unlinked/orphaned files, use KPro reorganization tools, not RSBCS_REORG:

  • RSKPRO_REORG ‚Äì main KPro reorg program

  • SDOK_PHIO_DELETE_UNUSED_LOIO ‚Äì deletes PHIOs without valid LOIO links

  • RSIRPIRL ‚Äì cleans up inconsistent KPro references

  • Transaction OAREORG (ArchiveLink/KPro reorganization)

These programs remove orphaned PHIO/LOIO objects from tables like SOFFPHIO / SOFFLOIO and from the Content Server.

Always test in QA and follow relevant SAP Notes for KPro cleanup before running in PRD.

entry.title: Re: Reading Private Note saved in the FPE1 Document
entry.content:
Confirmed üëç
Private notes in FPE1 are stored as GOS objects.
The link between DFKKOP-OPBEL and the SAPoffice document is in SRGBTBREL, and the note content can be read using SO_OBJECT_READ (SOOD as header).
READ_TEXT / STXH / STXB are not used in this case.

entry.title: Re: Get link for Service for objects
entry.content:
Services for Objects (GOS) attachments for Purchase Orders are linked via SRGBTBREL with TYPEID_A = BUS2012 (PO business object).
To retrieve attachments programmatically, you can use BDS_GOS_CONNECTIONS_GET or GOS classes CL_GOS*.
This blog explains it clearly: GOS ‚Äì Finding Attachments or Links to an Object in SAP/ABAP.

entry.title: Re: FB03: Report that identifies which ACCTG Documents ha...
entry.content:
There is no standard SAP report for this.
You can identify accounting documents with or without GOS PDF attachments by using a custom report or query:

  • Read BKPF for accounting documents (BUKRS, BELNR, GJAHR, BLART, USNAM, BUDAT).

  • Check SRGBTBREL for GOS attachments:

    • TYPEID_A = 'BKPF'

    • RELTYPE = 'ATTA'

    • INSTID_A = BUKRS + BELNR + GJAHR

  • If a record exists in SRGBTBREL, an attachment is present; if not, the document has no attachment.

If ArchiveLink is used instead of GOS, also check TOA01 with:

  • SAP_OBJECT = 'BKPF'

  • OBJECT_ID = AWKEY (BUKRS + BELNR + GJAHR)

This logic can be implemented via SQVI / Query or a Z-report.

entry.title: Re: Table that stores relationship document information
entry.content:
For FI documents created via IDocs, the relationship is not stored in SRGBTBREL.
Check BKPF-AWKEY (reference key) first ‚Äì in many FI IDoc scenarios it contains the IDoc number or a derivation of it.
If the IDoc is only visible via FB03 ‚Üí Services for Object ‚Üí Relationships, then the link is stored in BOR relationship tables such as SRRELROLES / SROBLREL / SRBCSBREL (depending on release).
The actual IDoc data can then be read from EDIDC / EDIDS using the IDoc number.

entry.title: Re: Attach files to GOS with Save, Retrieve, Delete functionality in SAP Web Dynpro ABAP - Part 2
entry.content: ‚ÄúVery detailed and helpful tutorial on GOS attachments in Web Dynpro ABAP. Thanks for sharing the complete end‚Äëto‚Äëend implementation, including create/change/delete scenarios.‚Äù

entry.title: Re: Meter reading notes
entry.content:
SAP does not provide a standard change document object to track creation, modification, or deletion of notes for Device Location or Connection Object (tables ENOTE / ENOTET).

  • Notes created via Services for Object (GOS) can be identified in table SRGBTBREL using:

    • TYPEID_A = 'DEVLOC' (Device Location)

    • TYPEID_A = 'PREMISES' (Connection Object)

  • However, SRGBTBREL does not store change history (only current links).

  • SAP IS‚ÄëU does not support change documents for ENOTE / ENOTET (confirmed by SAP).

Workaround options:

  1. Implement custom logging (Z-table) triggered during note create/change/delete.

  2. Use table logging / audit logging (SE13 / SCU3) if acceptable.

  3. For object-level changes (not note text), use CDHDR / CDPOS via
    ISU_CHANGEDOCUMENT_READ.

Conclusion: Tracking note changes requires a custom solution, as standard SAP logging is not available for IS‚ÄëU notes.

entry.title: Re: List of the attachments
entry.content:
Solution found: Attachments are stored via DMS.
Table DRAD, with Object Key = MATNR, gives the linked documents.

entry.title: Re: Attachment list from customer master sales area data
entry.content:
Attachments at sales area level are also stored in SRGBTBREL.
Use TYPEID_A = KNVV and RELTYPE = ATTA.
Note that INSTID_A is not just KUNNR ‚Äì it is the concatenation of KUNNR + VKORG + VTWEG + SPART.
If unsure, select from SRGBTBREL without filters and then filter by TYPEID_A = KNVV.

entry.title: Re: Migrating SAPOffice attachment from fileNet to SharePoint
entry.content: ‚ÄúSAP GOS/SAPoffice attachments cannot be re‚Äëlinked to SharePoint out of the box. A middleware (e.g. DM4SAP or YAC) is required. Migration works by keeping SRGBTBREL links intact and preserving Content Repository metadata (X‚ÄëContRep, DocID, CompID) while switching the repository to SharePoint.‚Äù

entry.title: Re: External vendor fields: CI_ include or separate append?
entry.content:
Hi, 

  • In this scenario, a separate append in the vendor namespace (e.g. /VENDOR/AKLAH) is usually the safer choice.

  • It keeps ownership and responsibility clear: everything in /VENDOR/‚Ä¶ is part of the vendor solution and can be analyzed or removed without touching customer enhancements.

  • For upgrades and maintenance, this separation makes impact analysis much easier, especially if you ever replace or stop using the vendor add-on.

  • CI_ includes work best for fields that are clearly customer-owned; mixing vendor and customer content there can make future cleanup and troubleshooting harder.

Some related references:

  • SAP Namespace concept: https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/index.htm?file=abenreserved_namespaces.htm‚Äã

  • Enhancement concept & append structures: https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/index.htm?file=abenenhancement_concept.htm

entry.title: Re: Z-tables in S4Hana Cloud development
entry.content:
Hi, 

  • You are right that FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1_SRV cannot be extended, so you will not be able to ‚Äúpush‚Äù HU header fields directly into that data source like in on‚Äëprem.‚Äã

  • Table‚Äëtype custom fields from a CBO are only handled as text in key user logic, so you cannot fill them like an internal table there; this is a current limitation of the in‚Äëapp extensibility tools.‚Äã

  • A common pattern in S/4HANA Cloud is:

    • Expose HU header via a released API or via a CBO/CDS view.

    • Build a custom CDS view that joins delivery item to HU header and marks the view as external API.

    • Use that as the data provider for a separate custom form / output scenario instead of trying to enhance the standard FDP service.‚Äã

  • If you must keep using YY1_FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1 with the standard data source only, you are probably running into a hard extensibility boundary and may need to open an SAP incident or request an enhancement for HU header fields in this data source.‚Äã‚Äã

Some references that explain the patterns and limits:

  • App extensibility for delivery documents: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/aff0b3f5f46c42a2b2c0fabfc233bab2/0ba5455849639244e10000000a4450e5.html‚Äã

  • Custom Fields and Logic (key user extensibility): https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/82db4418abc04f5c9ed44da3508deaa8.html

entry.title: Re: while creating PO or Contract need additional address details
entry.content:
Hello,

  • In standard, that popup is driven by the address data of the vendor / ordering address; the dialog itself is not very flexible for adding extra columns like city, state, street, etc.‚Äã

  • A typical approach is to enhance the search / selection help behind the ordering address (e.g. via custom search help / append, or BAdI in MM) so that the user can see more descriptive fields when choosing the address.‚Äã

  • If the business needs more context than the popup can reasonably show, another option is a custom F4 / custom screen or Fiori app that lists all potential addresses with full details and then returns the selected address key back to ME21N / ME31K.‚Äã

  • Also worth checking with your functional MM consultant if the address data in the vendor master / partner functions is maintained with clear naming (e.g. location name or region in name2 / search term) so that users can already distinguish addresses better in the existing popup.

entry.title: Re: GOS File Attachment Count
entry.content:
GOS attachments are linked to Business Objects, not directly to T‚ÄëCodes.
For example, ME23N / ME22N / ME21N all work on BUS2012 (Purchase Order).
There is no standard table that maps GOS attachments to a specific T‚ÄëCode.

To count attachments, use SRGBTBREL with:

  • TYPEID_A = BUS2012

  • RELTYPE = ATTA

If required, you can enrich the report by mapping Business Object ‚Üí display transactions (via SWO1 / method PurchaseOrder.Display), but T‚ÄëCode‚Äìwise attachment counting is not supported standardly.

entry.title: Re: how to enhance a custom columns in attachment list
entry.content: The custom column is added via SGOSATTR, but values are not displayed because data is still read from standard SRGBTBREL. Enhancement category is not classified, so the framework does not populate custom fields. Guidance on how to fill custom data (e.g. via BAdI GOS_SRV_REQUEST or custom service class) would help.

entry.title: Re: #COE#QDGG#can we do config on CBC during DEV upgrading?
entry.content:
Hi Eric,

Following please find the impacts to the CBC System during the Development System Upgrade,

1.Avoid large deployments from CBC from Tuesday or Wednesday and on (assume upgrade occurs on Saturday). Because we don‚Äôt want long running deployments (you cannot pause it in the middle) still running on CBC system and Dev system when Major Upgrade Window (MUW) starts.

2.Although you can work on CBC during the uptime phase until CBC Content Upgrade starts within the MUW on Saturday morning, deployments from CBC is disabled about 2 hours after Uptime Phase starts, i.e., 02:00 UTC on Friday (SAP Notes 3133118 and 321593), for the same reason as above.

3.Business Configuration is possible until 8 hours before downtime (SAP Note 3215993).

4.Organizational structure enhancements, new scope or country addition are possible until the CBC Business Content upgrade starts and the CBC Project is locked (SAP Note 3215993).

5..While the CBC Business Content is upgrade and activated, the CBC projects are locked.

6.As part of the CBC Business Content Upgrade, relevant content transports are created in the Dev System, and subsequently moved to the T and P Systems according to the existing transport schedule.

7.The CBC System is reopened after the end of the MUW.

 

BR, Yong

entry.title: HTML5 Application Migrated from NEO to Cloud Foundry Not Visible in BTP / Build Work Zone
entry.content:
We have a basic HTML (SAPUI5) application running on SAP NEO, which we are currently testing to migrate to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

We have completed the required configurations on the Cloud Foundry side and updated the following files accordingly:

  • xs-app.json

  • mta.yaml

  • xs-security.json

  • manifest.json

We successfully build the MTAR file and deploy it from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS). The deployment completes without any errors.

However, after deployment:

  • The application does not appear under HTML5 Applications in the SAP BTP cockpit

  • The application is also not visible in SAP Build Work Zone

  • We have already created an instance of HTML5 Application Repository Service with the app-host plan

Could you please help us understand:

  1. What could be the possible reasons for the application not appearing in HTML5 Applications or Build Work Zone?

  2. Are there any mandatory configurations or services (such as app-runtime, destination, XSUAA, or content module settings) that are commonly missed during NEO to Cloud Foundry migration?

  3. Are there any specific checks or logs we should verify after a successful MTAR deployment?

Any guidance or best practices for migrating HTML5 applications from NEO to Cloud Foundry would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: S/4HANA Logistics: Solving the "Not Possible to Determine Shipping Data" Block in STO
entry.content:
S/4HANA Logistics: Solving the "Not Possible to Determine Shipping Data" Block in STO

Published By :-

Er. Pratik Das

B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering

SAP Functional Consultant / SAP Coach

 Published: December 2025 Target Audience: S/4HANA Functional Consultants (MM/SD)

.........................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................

One of the most common tickets we see during the integration testing phase of an S/4HANA rollout is the missing "Shipping" tab in the Stock Transport Order (STO). When you check the logs, you‚Äôre hit with the hard error: "Not possible to determine shipping data for material &" (Message no. 06280).

In S/4HANA, the integration between Purchasing and Logistics Execution is significantly more rigid due to the Business Partner (BP) approach and the mandatory requirement for synchronized Master Data. If you are facing this error, the system is essentially telling you that the handshake between the Supplying Plant and the Receiving Plant is broken at the organizational level.

Below is a technical deep dive into the four critical configuration pillars required to resolve this.

  1. The BP Linkage (The S/4HANA Foundation)

In ECC, we dealt with Vendors and Customers. In S/4HANA, we deal with Business Partners. For an STO to function, the Receiving Plant must be represented as a Customer BP.

  • Verification: Ensure the BP representing the Receiving Plant is extended to the Sales Area (Sales Org/Dist. Channel/Division) associated with the Supplying Plant.
  • The "Link": In the Supplier Role (FLVN01), navigate to the Purchasing Data tab. Go to Additional Purchasing Data and ensure the Plant field is populated with the Supplying Plant ID. This is a mandatory link for the system to recognize the internal procurement relationship.
  1. Plant-Level Shipping Configuration (V_T001W)

This is the most common point of failure. The system needs a specific mapping to know which "Sales Entity" the Supplying Plant belongs to.

  • Path: IMG > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Set up Stock Transport Order > Define Shipping Data for Plants.
  • Action: 1. Select the Supplying Plant: Maintain the Sales Organization, Distribution Channel, and Division. 2. Select the Receiving Plant: Ensure the Customer Number (the BP created in Step 1) is assigned here.
  • Note: If the Customer Number is not assigned to the Receiving Plant in this table, the "Shipping" tab will never trigger in the PO.
  1. Material Master Extension (Sales Views)

It sounds fundamental, but it is often overlooked during mass data uploads (LTMC/Migrate Your Data).

  • The Requirement: The material must be extended to the Sales Org/Dist. Channel of the Supplying Plant.
  • Key Fields: * Loading Group: (Sales: General/Plant Data) ‚Äì Mandatory for shipping point determination later.
    • Material Tax Classification: Must be maintained, or the delivery creation will fail downstream.
    • Availability Check (Group): Ensure this is maintained to allow the system to calculate the delivery date.
  1. Delivery Type & Checking Rule Assignment

The system needs to know which document type to trigger (e.g., NL for Intra-company or NLCC for Inter-company).

  • Path: IMG > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Set up Stock Transport Order > Assign Delivery Type and Checking Rule.
  • Logic: Look for your PO Document Type (usually UB or NB) and your Supplying Plant.
  • Common Fix: Ensure that for your combination, the Delivery Type field is not blank. For S/4HANA Inter-company, this is typically NLCC.

Debugging Checklist for the Field

If you have performed the above and still face Message 06280, check these "hidden" culprits:

  1. Sales Area Alignment: Is the Sales Area assigned to the Supplying Plant in V_T001W exactly the same one the Material is extended to? A mismatch in Division is a frequent silent killer.
  2. Customer/BP Status: Check if the Customer BP has a "Central Deletion Flag" or "Sales Block." S/4HANA is much stricter about master data status than ECC.
  3. Ship-to Party Assignment: Does the Customer BP have a valid Ship-to Party (SH) partner function maintained for the specific Sales Area?

Conclusion

Message 06280 is a "Gatekeeper" error. It prevents you from proceeding because the foundational SD data is missing. By ensuring the BP is correctly mapped to the Plant and the Material is extended to the correct Sales Org, you can resolve this and enable the full Logistics Execution flow.

entry.title: Creation of Stock transfer from the sales order As Alternative-based-confirmation (ABC) with aATP
entry.content:
Most of the APO GATP customers use Location and / or material substitutions. Location substitution is used to check the availability of a material in a different plant if the material is not available in the plant of the sales order. Suppose, Sales order for material is being created in Frankfurt plant and the same material is not available in Frankfurt plant, then the system can check its availability in an alternative plant (say plant in Munich) and confirm the sales order. 

Alternative-based-confirmation (ABC) has been introduced in Advanced ATP (AATP) in 1809 release of SAP S/4HANA. ABC is a functionality similar to plant substitution of SAP APO ‚Äì global ATP (GATP) i.e if the material is not available in the sales order plant , then system automatically looks for its availability in other plants . Refer my earlier blogs on ABC link https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/alternative-based-confirmation-abc-of-advanced-atp-in-s-4hana-1809-release/ba-p/13387574 , https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/new-and-enhanced-features-of-alternative-based-confirmation-abc-of-advanced/ba-p/13427376

Prior to S/4HANA 2025 release , ABC substitutes plant in following ways

  • Inline substitution : Original delivering plant of sales order gets changed by the substituted plant as in below image

  • Subitem generation : Original delivering plant remains same as main item of the sales order , a subitem is generated with the plant in which the material is available as displayed in below image.

Delivery happens with the substituted plant (for inline substitution) or with subitem of the sales orders. Many customers do not want the delivering plant of the sales order to be substituted i.e they want the delivery to take place from the original delivering plant due to the reasons like below

  • A hub is created for consolidation of materials and subsequent delivery to the customer. Manufacturing plants and ( or vendors) send the materials to the hub and a delivery is created from the hub (customer delivery plant) for all the materials
  • A specific delivering plant needs to be used for specific business reasons like tax , customs etc

S/4HANA 2025 release has provided an option to check material availability in alternative plants ,  create the stock transfer automatically from the plant in which material is available to the delivering plant of the sale order as depicted in below image.

There is no stock of the material FG_ABC_STO_01 in plant 1010 , but stock is available in plant 1020 for the same material.

Sales order is confirmed with its original delivering plant 1010 with the material to be received from the stock transfer from the plant 1020 as shown in below images.

The following configurations / settings are required to achieve the Alternative-based-confirmation (ABC) with auto creation of stock transfer order

  • Stock transfer (along with its document type) needs to be set ON in app ‚ÄòConfigure Substitution Strategy‚Äô as in below image.

  • Relevant material with its CVC needs to be set in app ‚Äò Configure Alternative Control‚Äô as depicted below.

  • SAP note 3698026 needs to be implemented

 

This blog is based on my personal tests , observations , insights in S/4HANA 2025 release. Will appreciate your feedback / comments.

entry.content:
Dear All.

I want to automatically calculate taxes in ABAP development in Public Cloud.

But,  I have understood that can't use CALCULATE_TAX_FROM_NET_AMOUNT in Public Cloud.

So, Please let me know how to  automatically calculate taxes in ABAP development in Public Cloud.

‚Äª Alternative to CALCULATE_TAX_FROM_NET_AMOUNT in Public Cloud.

Best Regards,

entry.title: Re: Alternative to CALCULATE_TAX_FROM_NET_AMOUNT in Publi...
entry.content: sorry, i'm duplicate answer

entry.title: Re: Alternative to CALCULATE_TAX_FROM_NET_AMOUNT in Public Cloud
entry.content: In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no direct alternative to CALCULATE_TAX_FROM_NET_AMOUNT. Tax calculation must be handled by the standard tax determination framework via released APIs and document processing. Custom ABAP logic cannot calculate taxes directly; instead, developers should provide correct tax-relevant data and let SAP calculate taxes automatically.

entry.title: Re: Regarding to sort by name in Search Help of Cost Center
entry.content: In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the sort order of value helps in standard Fiori apps cannot be changed. However, for custom apps, it is possible to create a CDS value help view and define the sort order via @ui.presentationVariant. Example of a custom CDS Value Help for Cost Center sorted by name:

entry.title: Re: Regarding to sort by name in Search Help of Cost Center
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the sort order of value helps in standard Fiori apps cannot be changed. However, for custom apps, it is possible to create a CDS value help view and define the sort order via @ui.presentationVariant. Example of a custom CDS Value Help for Cost Center sorted by name:
@EndUserText.label: 'Value Help Cost Center sorted by Name'
@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZVHCCTRNAME'
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK
@ObjectModel.dataCategory: #VALUE_HELP
@ObjectModel.representativeKey: 'CostCenter'
@search.searchable: true
@ui.presentationVariant: [{ sortOrder: [{ by: 'CostCenterName', direction: #ASC }] }] define view entity Z_I_CostCenterVHByName as select from I_CostCenter { key CostCenter, CostCenterName, ControllingArea, CompanyCode }

entry.title: Managing Invoices with SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management on SAP BTP provides a unified solution for receiving and managing supplier invoices, with connection to multiple systems, such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA, and SAP ERP systems.
SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management must be connected to at least one system, but a combination of multiple system connections is also possible. The following systems can be connected to SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
SAP S/4HANA
SAP ERP
A classic invoicing solution, SAP Ariba Buying and Invoicing or SAP Ariba Invoice Management

var payload = new

entry.title: SAP CPQ - Headless Configurator (Configurations v2 API)
entry.content:
What is the Headless Configurator?

The Headless Configurator decouples the user interface from the configuration engine. Instead of relying on SAP CPQ‚Äôs native UI, external applications‚Äîsuch as eCommerce sites, dealer portals, mobile apps, or kiosks‚Äîcan call SAP CPQ‚Äôs Configuration V2 API to handle all configuration logic, rules, and pricing in real time.

This means:

  • Your front-end remains lightweight and fully customizable.
  • SAP CPQ continues to be the single source of truth for product rules and pricing.
  • No duplication of logic across channels.

How It Works

  1. Create Configuration
    External systems initiate a configuration session by calling the Create Configuration endpoint with product and context parameters (Market, Pricebook, Currency, Effective Date, Business Partners).

  2. Dynamic Updates
    Every attribute change triggers a Patch Configuration call. SAP CPQ responds with updated valid values, rule messages, and pricing deltas‚Äîensuring guided selling and compliance.

  3. Finalize and Order
    Once configuration is complete, the external system retrieves the final configuration and either:

    • Places the order directly in ERP, S/4 HANA or S/4 HANA Public Cloud or
    • Creates a quote in SAP CPQ for sales-assisted workflows.

Primary Use Cases

  1. 3rd‚Äëparty eCommerce: A modern online shopping interface with a dynamic product configurator and real-time pricing updates in the cart.
  2. Reseller/Dealer Portal: A professional dashboard with tailored product variants and pricebook context, emphasizing collaboration and customization.
  3. Self‚ÄëService Web/Mobile: An enterprise buyer using a tablet to configure complex assets independently, with an option to escalate to sales.
  4. Embedded Apps: A field technician at a kiosk using a lightweight app with SAP CPQ rules and pricing integrated seamlessly.
    The scene should feature a clean, high-tech aesthetic with glowing UI elements, holographic screens, and a connected network theme. Use vibrant colors like blue, teal, and white to convey trust, innovation, and transparency. Include subtle SAP branding elements without overpowering the design. Style: ultra-realistic with a touch of futuristic minimalism.

Why It Matters

The Configuration V2 API is more than a technical upgrade‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic enabler for omnichannel selling, digital transformation, and partner ecosystem growth. By centralizing configuration intelligence in SAP CPQ and exposing it headlessly, businesses can innovate faster, reduce risk, and deliver consistent, guided experiences everywhere.

E2E Flow ‚Äî Anonymous eCommerce (configure ‚Üí order)

 

E2E Flow ‚Äî Dealer Portal (configure ‚Üí sales‚Äëassist ‚Üí quote/order)

Next Steps

Ready to unlock the power of headless configuration? Explore SAP CPQ‚Äôs API documentation or reach out to me SAP CPQ Solution Architect to learn how Configuration V2 can fit into your digital strategy.

API Documentation : Configurations v2 API

Create configuration: 

POST /api/configuration/v2/configurations
{
  "ProductSystemId": "LAPTOP-PRO-15",
  "Context": {
    "MarketCode": "US",
    "PricebookCode": "B2C",
    "CurrencyCode": "USD",
    "EffectiveDate": "2025-10-16",
    "InvolvedParties": [{ "Key": "SoldTo", "ExternalId": "CUST-123" }],
    "ExtensionFields": [{ "Name": "Channel", "Value": "WebshopA" }]
  }
}

 Get configuration: 

GET /api/configuration/v2/configurations/{configurationId}?$select=attributes,values,pricingDetails
Accept-Language: de-DE

 Patch configuration: 

PATCH /api/configuration/v2/configurations/{configurationId}
{
  "Attributes": [
    { "Id": 1001, "Values": [{ "Id": 9001, "IsSelected": true }] }
  ]
}

Delete configuration:

DELETE /api/configuration/v2/configurations/{configurationId}

Note: Not allowed if configuration is attached to a quote item.

entry.title: Re: How to restrict multiple PRT group selection.
entry.content: User Exit PPCO0009 (Check before order release) - This exit allows you to perform custom validations before the release is finalized. You can read both header and operation data from the order tables (AFKO, AFVC, AFFH for PRTs) and enforce that only one PRT group is assigned. You can implement a check in this exit by reading the operation PRT assignments (table AFFH) and ensuring only one group is present. If multiple groups are found, you can raise an error message to stop the release.

entry.title: Re: CEWB component signal is not greyed after deleted com...
entry.content:
In CEWB (Engineering Workbench), the ‚Äúcomponent signal/light‚Äù indicator is not a real-time reflection of the BOM but rather of the assignment status stored in the order/routing data. When you initially assign components to an operation, CEWB marks the operation as ‚Äúhaving components.‚Äù If those components are later deleted from the BOM, the assignment flag in the order/routing may not automatically reset. This is why the signal/light still shows, even though no components are visible. In other words, the indicator is based on the existence of prior assignments, not a dynamic check of current BOM content.

If you ask whether this is a bug, SAP generally classifies this as standard system behavior, not a bug. The system doesn‚Äôt retroactively clear the indicator when BOM changes are made outside the CEWB assignment process. It is a known limitation CEWB doesn‚Äôt always synchronize the ‚Äúcomponent assignment indicator‚Äù with BOM deletions.

Some possible ways to deal with this are

  • Run transaction CS20 or BOM consistency checks to ensure assignments are updated.
  • Manually refresh in CEWB. Sometimes reloading or reassigning the operation in CEWB clears the indicator.
  • If business-critical, you can implement a check (e.g., via exit CPCC0007 or similar routing exits) to reset the flag when no components are found.

entry.title: Re: CDs View for Cost Center Budget
entry.content:
Hello Meraj,

If you are developing custom reports using sap delivered and released CDS views then better to chose other CDS views. The details of the parameters/purpose/fields can be found in the link: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/1c5cac767ec3460c97040eb3b0d9af2b.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=LATEST&q=C_COSTCENTERBUDGETQUERY

Regards.

entry.title: Re: assign the company codes from different countries to...
entry.content: If this is still in the Explore/Realize phase, the cleanest path is to start a new CBC project with the correct design (all company codes under one company). If you are already in productive use, you‚Äôll need to raise an SAP incident to request a reset, since CBC does not provide a direct ‚Äúedit‚Äù option for confirmed assignments.

entry.title: Re: How to link an expense account to a vendor?
entry.content:
In FI postings, when you enter a vendor number, the system automatically derives the reconciliation account from the vendor master record. However, SAP does not provide a standard field in the vendor master to directly store and default an expense account. The reconciliation account is for balance sheet purposes, not for P&L expense determination.

Standard options which you can consider

Account Assignment Model (Transaction O7AA / FB50, FB60, etc.)
You can pre‚Äëdefine templates that link a vendor to a specific expense account. When posting, the model can be called up, and the system fills in the expense account automatically.

Recurring Entries / Sample Documents
If the vendor is always paid for the same expense (e.g., rent, utilities), you can create a recurring entry or sample document with the vendor and expense account combination. This ensures the expense account is defaulted each time.

Substitution Rules (Transaction GGB1)
You can define a substitution in FI so that when a specific vendor is entered, the system automatically substitutes or proposes the corresponding expense account. This is often used for automation of account determination.

Vendor Master Enhancements (Custom)
If you want a truly ‚Äúhard link‚Äù between vendor and expense account, you will need a small enhancement: add a custom field in the vendor master for ‚Äúdefault expense account‚Äù and use a BAdI/User Exit to populate the account during posting.

entry.title: Re: customer hierarchy derivation error
entry.content:
Some of the reasons why you see ‚ÄúNo value found‚Äù

KNVH structure:
The customer hierarchy table (KNVH) stores data with specific keys ‚Äî sales organization, distribution channel, division, hierarchy node, validity dates, etc.

Derivation rule lookup:
When you define a table lookup in FMDERIVE (or similar derivation tool), the system matches exactly on the source fields you‚Äôve mapped. If any of those fields don‚Äôt line up (e.g., wrong sales org, missing distribution channel, or date not within validity), the lookup will fail even though you see entries in KNVH.

VDH1N vs. KNVH:
In VDH1N you can see the hierarchy, but the derivation rule may not be using the same combination of fields that uniquely identify the record in KNVH.

Do the following to fix the issue

  • Check the derivation rule field mapping and make sure all mandatory KNVH key fields are included in the lookup.
  • Verify validity dates and confirm the posting date is within the KNVH record‚Äôs validity period.
  • Test with SE16N and run a manual lookup in KNVH with the exact source values from your posting to see if a record is returned.
  • Adjust derivation rule, if you only want to derive based on customer number, consider creating a custom table (Z-table) with simplified mapping, then use that in the derivation rule instead of KNVH.
  • Alternative approach is to explore a function module derivation step instead of direct table lookup, so you can code the hierarchy logic more flexibly.

entry.title: Re: How to create sales area through migration cockpit wh...
entry.content:
When you load only the company code data, the customer exists purely as an FI customer. Later, when you try to ‚Äúextend‚Äù with sales area data using the template Customer ‚Äì extend existing record by new org levels, the cockpit expects the customer to already exist with the supplier role or with the correct org level combination. That‚Äôs why it says ‚Äúcustomer doesn‚Äôt exist as a supplier‚Äù ‚Äî the template is designed to extend into new company codes, not to add SD views. Having said that in Public Cloud you cannot retroactively add sales area data to a customer created only with company code data via the same template.

Some options are

Use the dedicated template ‚ÄúCustomer ‚Äì extend existing record by new sales area‚Äù
This template is available in the migration object list. It allows you to add SD views to an existing FI customer. If you don‚Äôt see it, check whether your migration project scope includes the SD business role.

Re‚Äëload the customer with both company code and sales area data
The recommended approach is to prepare the template with both FI and SD data and reload, because Public Cloud cockpit is stricter than ECC.

Post‚Äëmigration maintenance via Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Customer Master Data‚Äù
If migration cockpit doesn‚Äôt support the extension you need, you can manually add the sales area data in the Fiori app. This is often the fallback in Public Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Hot to handle discount in provider API for invoicing...
entry.content: In the SAP Logistics Invoice Provider API, discounts are handled as charges with specific codes. You cannot post a ‚Äú10%‚Äù directly ‚Äî you must convert the discount into an amount. The recommended approach is to use a discount charge code (e.g., DISCNT_AMOUNT or DISCNT_PERCENT depending on your configuration), but the payload must carry a numeric value. Negative amounts are technically accepted, but SAP advises using a dedicated discount charge type rather than posting negative rates

entry.title: Re: Price of intercompany inventory transfer order (5HP)
entry.content:
In an intercompany stock transfer (process type 5HP), the PO is created in the receiving company code, while the SO is created in the delivering company code. Each document determines its price independently:

  • PO uses purchasing conditions (info record, condition schema, valuation).
  • SO uses sales pricing conditions (pricing procedure, condition records).

SAP deliberately allows them to differ because intercompany transfer pricing is often set up to reflect internal transfer prices (not necessarily equal to procurement valuation).

If your business requirement is to have the SO price = PO price, you have a few options:

Condition technique alignment
Configure a dedicated intercompany pricing procedure for the SO. Use condition type PI01 (Intercompany Price) or similar, which can be set to copy the PO net price. Maintain condition records so that the SO picks up the same value as the PO.

Intercompany billing configuration
In customizing (SPRO ‚Üí Sales and Distribution ‚Üí Billing ‚Üí Intercompany Billing), you can set the intercompany billing to use the PO price as the basis for the SO/billing document. This ensures consistency between procurement and sales.

Exit/BAdI enhancement
Use User Exit MV45AFZZ (FORM USEREXIT_PRICING_PREPARE_TKOMK/TKOMP) in SD to override the SO price with the PO price. Alternatively, in S/4HANA, use BAdI SD_SALES_PRICE_COPY or SD_SALES_DOCUMENT enhancements to fetch the PO price and apply it to the SO. But this should be your last option if standard configuration does not meet the Business requirement due to other custom validations in place

entry.title: Re: Cross-company stock transfer orderÔºàSTOÔºâCommitments
entry.content:
Since you are on S/4HANA OP 2022, SAP has introduced optional functionality to allow commitments for cross‚Äëcompany stock transfers with account assignment. The mechanism is controlled by BAdI ME_COMMITMENT_STO_CH (see Notes 604033 and 2831505). If you don‚Äôt implement this BAdI, the system still creates the commitment document structure, but without a value ‚Äî hence you see a ‚Äúzero value‚Äù commitment.

If you want to follow the standard (no commitments for STO), you can ignore the zero‚Äëvalue document. If you want commitments to reflect the WBS assignment, you must implement the BAdI.

In this enhancement, you can define how the system should calculate the commitment value for cross‚Äëcompany STOs. Typically, you would pass the PO valuation price or a transfer price so that the WBS commitment is meaningful.

Ensure your account assignment category for the STO is correctly set to WBS (Q). Verify that the commitment update is active in Funds Management/PS settings.

entry.title: Re: Subcontracting PO scenario with External Manufacturer...
entry.content: Standard SAP best practice is keep EM as subcontractor vendor in CC A. Route international imports through Plant B (CC B) ‚Üí Plant X (CC A) via intercompany STO. Plant X then issues the materials to EM. This way, commitments, inventory valuation, and WBS/CO postings remain consistent across company codes. If business insists on DC shipping directly to EM, you need a dual role setup (EM as customer in CC B) and configure intercompany sales.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Returns (RMA) Across Two Plants / Two Compan...
entry.content:
To the question "Is it supported?", below is the answer

Supported in principle: ARM is flexible enough to handle returns across multiple plants and company codes. The returned material can be received in Plant A, inspected, and then transferred to Plant B for repair.

Key limitation: ARM itself does not ‚Äúnatively‚Äù manage intercompany logistics; you must integrate it with cross‚Äëcompany stock transfer and intercompany billing processes.

Best practice: Treat Plant B as the repair center and configure ARM follow‚Äëup codes so that the material can be moved from Plant A to Plant B, repaired, and then shipped back to the customer directly from Plant B

To make this work, you need to ensure:

  • Activate ARM for your return order types in SD.
  • Define follow‚Äëup activities (e.g., ‚ÄúSend to repair center‚Äù) that trigger a stock transfer from Plant A to Plant B.
  • Cross‚Äëcompany STO setup:
    • Create STO between Plant A (CC A) and Plant B (CC B).
    • Configure delivery and billing for intercompany transfers.
  • Repair process in Plant B:
    • Plant B receives the material, performs repair, and posts goods issue back to the customer.
    • ARM follow‚Äëup code ‚ÄúSend back to customer‚Äù is executed from Plant B.
  • Intercompany billing:
    • Ensure intercompany billing between CC A and CC B is configured so costs/revenues are correctly posted.
  • Inspection and decision profiles:
    • Use ARM inspection (transaction MSR_INSPWH) to decide whether repair is possible in Plant A or whether transfer to Plant B is required.

entry.title: Re: Cross-company stock transfer orderÔºàSTOÔºâCommitments
entry.content: 1.the WBS's company is 1010 and the network„ÄÅactivity company and factory is also 1010. 2.we create the cross-company stock tranfer requisition through MD04, supply factory is 1000. purchase requisition account assignment is Q and the item category is U and exist valuation price. once create the cross-company PR, the commitment document valuation will be zero and marked with a deletion indicator. we understand it cause we use the U item category to affect the amount of the commitment document to be 0. 3.Create a cross-company stock tranfer Order with reference to the Purchase Requisition with account assignment is Q and the item category is empty. (reference to 3189190 ) The commitment cost is updated based on the net value of the purchase order. The increase in commitment costs has led to WBS budget overrun. This is not what we expected. 4.If we set the item category of the purchase requisition to empty (to align with the purchase order) and only retain the Q account assignment category, the commitment cost will be generated from the purchase requisition and then flow to the purchase order. HoweverÔºåwe never implement BADI ME_COMMITMENT_STO_CH from 604033

entry.title: SAP BP best practice: payer vs bill to when member VAT must appear and paying agent settles?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm seeking guidance on best practices for Business Partner configuration, where the BP represents the payer in our company, in a complex payer/agent scenario where contractual terms and VAT requirements drive the setup.

Scenario:

  • There is a member and a paying agent.

  • The paying agent explicitly requires that the member‚Äôs VAT number is shown on the invoice, with the paying agent appearing as C/O.

  • VAT determination is driven by the payer at the sales org level.

  • Currently, the paying agent is maintained as the payer, including their VAT number.

  • From a contractual perspective:

    • The paying agent settles the invoice

    • Credit notes should be raised to the member

    • Payments for credit notes should be made to the bank account of the paying agent

Key questions:

  1. From an SAP BP/AR perspective, would it be more appropriate to:

    • Maintain the paying agent as Bill to, and

    • Maintain the member as Payer, given the VAT and invoicing requirements?

  2. How should the VAT registration numbers be maintained to ensure correct VAT determination and compliant invoice output?

  3. What is the recommended approach for bank master data when:

    • The credit note is issued to one BP (member),

    • But the payment is made to another BP‚Äôs bank account (paying agent)?

  4. Are there standard SAP patterns (e.g., account relationships, alternative payee, or FI customization) that you would recommend for this type of setup?

Any insights, examples, or references to SAP standard practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Create a cross-company stock tranfer Order with reference to the Purchase Requisition with account assignment is Q and the item category is empty. (reference to 3189190 ) The commitment cost is updated based on the net value of the purchase order. The increase in commitment costs has led to WBS budget overrun. We expectedÔºöNeither cross-company purchase requisitions nor cross-company purchase orders shall generate commitment documents, or the amount of commitment cost shall be zero).

entry.title: Re: I can create delivery for a different shipping point...
entry.content: Why it happens is because, in SAP SD, the shipping point is determined at delivery creation time, not strictly fixed from the sales order. The system re‚Äëruns shipping point determination based on your OVL2 configuration. Having said that, do you have multiple shipping points for the same combination in OVL2? To answer your question yes, it is standard SAP behavior. The delivery is technically independent and can be created with another valid shipping point if customizing permits. SAP does not hard‚Äëlock the shipping point from the sales order to the delivery.

entry.title: Re: PO Creation ME21N
entry.content:
Each company code is assigned a country, and each country has a tax procedure (via OBYZ/OBBG). If MY02‚Äôs country is not assigned the same tax procedure (or no procedure at all), the system won‚Äôt propose a tax code.

In ME21N, the tax code can be proposed based on Condition records (via tax condition types in the pricing procedure), Account assignment category (e.g., direct cost center) and Plant settings (tax indicators in plant master). If LU27 has condition records or plant tax indicators maintained, but MY02 does not, you‚Äôll see the difference.

If jurisdiction codes are active, the plant‚Äôs address (region, county, city) must be maintained. Missing address data in MY02 can prevent tax code determination.

For direct cost center postings, the cost center‚Äôs company code and controlling area must align. If MY02‚Äôs cost center master lacks tax‚Äërelated indicators, the tax code won‚Äôt default.

entry.title: Legacy Data Transfer - OTC Transactions
entry.content:
Purpose

This blog primarily outlines the process of transferring legacy data of OTC transactions (money market, foreign exchange, OTC derivatives, and trade finance) from external systems into the Treasury and Risk Management (TRM) module, as a critical step in initial go-live data migration. The process is illustrated using an example of interest rate instrument (a product category of money market) in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Foundational Knowledge

To fully engage with the content ahead, familiarity with the following foundational concepts is recommended:

  • The position components constitute the financial position of an interest rate instrument ‚Äì refer to blog Position Changes and Postings Across the Life of an Interest Rate Instrument or relevant SAP held documents for detailed context.
  • How accrual of interest income or expenses works ‚Äì refer to blog Accrual: Reset Procedure and Difference Procedure or relevant SAP held documents for detailed context.

Migration of Transactions

The financial transactions can be imported into TRM by using the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit. For migration of interest rate instrument, the migration cockpit object ‚ÄúTRM - Interest rate instrument‚Äù can be used. You can find more information regarding data migration of TRM from help document Treasury and Risk Management.

The specific steps for importing transactions via the Migration Cockpit are not elaborated on here. We assume the following investment transaction of interest rate instrument has been imported into the system, which means, the transaction has been created in TRM.

Major contract elements:

  • Nominal amount: 1,000.000.00 USD
  • Payment amount: 998,000.00 USD (discount: 2,000.00 USD)
  • Term start: 01.10.2025
  • Term end: 01.04.2026
  • Interest rate: 3% (act/360)
  • Interest frequency: 2 months
  • Repayment structure: financial repayment

Cash flow:

Enter Position Component Values

Let‚Äôs assume that the go-live of TRM is planned at 01.01.2026, so that the position component values of this transaction as of 31.12.2025 should be also migrated from position management and financial accounting perspectives.

Previously in the migrated/created transaction, we specified a general valuation class which derives the valuation class and position management procedure for Fair Value through OCI (FVOCI) within the valuation area 002 (IFRS). In this illustrative example, we will always focus on valuation area 002 only, the details for legacy data transfer of other valuation areas are omitted although they are also needed.

The underlying message is that, in the legacy system, this transaction is also classified and measured at FVOCI, and the position of this transaction as of 31.12.2025 may include the position components of purchase value, security valuation (including Security Valuation, Not Affecting P/L), FX valuation, in the terminology of SAP TRM. In the meantime, the accrual of interest income based on the nominal interest up to 31.12.2025 should also be considered. Moreover, since the company code‚Äôs local currency is EUR, the valuation currency is EUR, which is different from position currency USD (=the transaction currency), the values in both USD and EUR should be considered during legacy data transfer.

You may ask why choosing FVOCI to illustrate legacy data transfer, it is because FVOCI is more complicated than other classifications, such as amortized cost (no security valuation) or FVTPL (no amortization).

Now, let‚Äôs enter the valuation area-dependent position component values for this transaction by using the app Enter Position Component Values - Legacy Data Transfer (app ID: TPM63C). Screen-shots:

Field

Data used in this example

Remark for the field

Position Value Date

31.12.2025

 

Company Code

1010

 

General Valuation Class

22

 

Valuation Area

002

 

Transaction

1000000000107

 

Position Currency

USD

 

Valuation Currency

EUR

 

Security Valuation in Position Currency

500.50

Positive value for write-up;

Negative value for write-down.

Security Valuation in Valuation Currency

426.23

Positive value for write-up;

Negative value for write-down.

FX Valuation in Valuation Currency

-1799.10

Positive value for write-up;

Negative value for write-down.

Amortization in Position Currency

999.50

Positive value for positive amortization;

Negative value for negative amortization.

Amortization in Valuation Currency

851.17

Positive value for positive amortization;

Negative value for negative amortization.

Security valuation, not affecting P/L, in position currency

500.50

This is not needed if security valuation doesn‚Äôt update OCI (not affecting P/L).

Security valuation, not affecting P/L, in valuation currency

426.23

This is not needed if security valuation doesn‚Äôt update OCI (not affecting P/L).

Accrual/deferral (1) in position currency

2,583.33

Usually, positive value for accrual of income from investment, negative value for accrual of expenses from borrowing.

Accrual/deferral (1) in valuation currency

2,195.31

Usually, positive value for accrual of income from investment, negative value for accrual of expenses from borrowing.

Accrual/deferral with Reset

X

If this indicator is set, a reset business transaction for the transferred accruals/deferrals is generated additionally.

Reset Date

01.01.2026

If the reset date is not entered, the reset will occur on ‚Äúposition value date + 1‚Äù.

Notes:

  • Not every available field of TPM63C are listed in the above table.
  • Component purchase value can‚Äôt be specified in TPM63C, because it is specified in the transaction.
  • In this example, the ‚ÄúAccrual/deferral with Reset‚Äù indicator is set, because the accrual of interest income for the nominal interest flows (update type MM1200+) after go-live will use Reset procedure. If the Difference Procedure for accrual will be used, then legacy data transfer for accrual part should be handled differently, there will be a separate section below to introduce it accordingly.

Beside manually entering the values via app TPM63C, there is a migration cockpit object ‚ÄúTRM - Position values‚Äù for mass importing the position component values.

Mark Flow as Fixed

After the transaction is changed to ‚Äòcontract settlement‚Äô status, use app Mark Flows as Fixed - Legacy Data Transfer (app ID: TBB1_LC) to set the cash flows (up to 31.12.2025) to ‚ÄúFixed‚Äù status without actually posting them.

The posting log is also available after successful execution of TBB1_LC, however, the document numbers are empty, because TBB1_LC doesn‚Äôt update general ledger accounting actually.

Check the cash flows in the transaction, the flows of principal increase (01.10.2025) and 1st nominal interest (01.12.2025) are ‚ÄúFixed (not relevant for posting)‚Äù.

If you check the corresponding position flows through app Treasury Position Flows ‚Äì Classic (app ID: TPM13), you will find they are also ‚Äúfixed‚Äù in all valuation areas (screen-shot is omitted for TPM13 here).

It is highly recommended that you enter the exchange rates as of 01.10.2025 in the system (it is USD/EUR = 0.8516 in this this example), or edit the local currency amount of the cash flow with flow type 1100 in the transaction, before executing TBB1_LC. Because TBB1_LC will fix the valuation currency amount of MM1100- position flow, and update the position component of purchase value in valuation currency for position management. The MM1100- flow‚Äôs valuation currency amount (local currency amount in transaction‚Äôs cash flow) should reflect the corresponding exchange rate which was used to translate the transaction currency amount 998,000.00 USD to amount in EUR in the legacy system, otherwise the book value may not be correct in valuation currency amount after legacy data transfer.

You can also check the app Treasury Position Values - Classic (app ID: TPM12) for key date 31.12.2025. In TPM12, you can see the components Purchase Value in PC and Purchase Value in VC have been ‚Äòdetermined‚Äô, and the deriving position component (e.g. acquisition value, amortized acquisition value, book value) are calculated accordingly.

Initial Load of Position Values

Use the app Initial Load of Position Values - Legacy Data Transfer (app ID: TPM63) to read legacy data you‚Äôve entered in TPM63C and transfer it to the position management of TRM.

There are 3 options for ‚ÄúAccounting Update‚Äù:

  • Do Not Update: choose this option if the accounting data is migrated via other means other than TRM (e.g. migrated the balances of position account, accrual account, OCI account in general ledger accounting). No posting will be generated from TPM63 if this option is selected.
  • Update: choose this option and then TPM63 will generate accounting documents for legacy data transfer related business transactions, usually using update type DT_*; and the postings rely on the account determination setup for those update types.
  • Update Only for Reset Business Transactions: if you have migrated accounting data by other means only up to the transfer key date, and you would like to post the reset business transactions (for amortizations, valuations, or accruals/deferrals) through TPM63, you can choose this option.

In this example, we choose Update to illustrate the whole picture of postings.

Log for TPM63 run:

You can also check the posting log by clicking Logs and Messages, the screen-shot is omitted here. Instead, let‚Äôs use the T-accounts to illustrate the effects of postings generated from TPM63 run:

First, look at the posting journals except the reset posting on 01.01.2026:

The position account, accrual account, and OCI account, all of the relevant balance sheet accounts have correctly reflected the balances which are equal to the legacy system‚Äôs data for this transaction, in both of position currency and valuation currency. The Financial Statement of Position as of reporting date 31.12.2025 then can be properly prepared in SAP system. Please note the figures highlighted in orange are for the purchase value component, assume they are migrated into SAP general ledger accounting directly, neither by TBB1_LC nor TPM63.

Check the position flows in TPM13:

Check the position component values in TPM12 as of 31.12.2025:

Illustrate the calculation logic of position component values in the following manner:

Let‚Äôs then include the effects of DT_C013 posted on 01.01.2026:

At the date 01.01.2026, the balance of accrual account is zero, and interest income account is debited in posting period Jan. 2025 (entries are highlighted in green).

You may have a question: usually the migration for financial accounting data should be limited to balance sheet accounts, why reset business transaction DB_C013 posts to P&L account in this example? Let‚Äôs move to the next section ‚ÄúMonth-End Close after Go-live‚Äù.

Month-End Close after Go-live

During the first month-end close for Jan. 2026 after go-live, run TPM1 valuation for this transaction, before that, the NPV (fair value, 998,900.00 USD) has been entered for 31.01.2026. Check valuation log (The specific logic is not elaborated on here):

Run TPM44 accrual for key date 31.01.2026. Check log:

It is worth noting that TPM44 picks up the MM1200+ nominal interest flow with calculation-from date 01.12.2025 and calculation-to date 01.02.2026, totally 62 days within its interest period, and the AD1000 business transaction covers 62 days as well and accrues the whole period of MM1200+. You may raise a concern that shouldn‚Äôt TPM44 only cover 31 days (01.01.2026 to 31.01.2026), as the cut-off date for migration is the end of 2025? Under reset procedure, TPM44 always calculates the accrual amount starting from the calculation-from date of MM1200+, disregarding that its calculation-from is prior to the cut-off date. That‚Äôs why DT_C013 should debit interest income at the beginning of 2025.

Let‚Äôs check the T-accounts and position components in the following manner.

With the joint effects of DT_C013 and AD1000 in period of January, the interest income recognized because of accrual (and reset of accrual) in Jan. 2026 = 5,166.67 - 2,583.33 = 2,583.34 USD, this is the amount of interest income in position currency arising from the nominal interest that is attributable to Jan. 2025 from accrual accounting perspective. This kind of posting logic ensures the correctness of Income Statement as of Jan. 2026.

If the difference procedure is used for accrual, the approach to legacy data transfer should differ‚Äîfor details, refer to the next section.

Difference Procedure for Accrual

Besides modifying the configuration to the style of difference procedure in the configuration activity 102925 ‚ÄúAssign Update Types for Accrual/Deferral‚Äù which has been descried in blog Accrual: Reset Procedure and Difference Procedure, additional configuration should be added in the configuration activity 104457 ‚ÄúAssign Additional Update Types for Difference Procedure‚Äù, sample configuration as below:

With this setting, TPM44 run after go-live will be able to consider the accrual recorded via legacy data transfer (e.g., DT_C011) and include it in the accrual calculation as an offset of MM1200+, under difference procedure.

When entering position component values via TPM63C, the following values can be used. For fields not included in the table below, the corresponding values are consistent with those in the reset procedure example provided above.

Field

Data used in this example

Remark for the field

‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶

 

Accrual/deferral (1) in position currency

7,666.66

2,583.33 USD (accrual account balance as of 31.12.2025)+ 5,083.33 USD from the fixed nominal interest flow on 01.12.2025

Accrual/deferral (1) in valuation currency

6,503.43

2,195.31 EUR (accrual account balance as of 31.12.2025)+ 4,308.12 EUR from the fixed nominal interest flow on 01.12.2025

Accrual/deferral (2) in position currency

-5,083.33

Position currency amount of the fixed nominal interest flow on 01.12.2025

Accrual/deferral (2) in valuation currency

-4,308.12

Valuation currency amount of the fixed nominal interest flow on 01.12.2025

Accrual/deferral with Reset

Blank

 

Reset Date

Blank

 

Screen-shot of TPM63C:

Executing TPM63. The log of it:

Show the results in T-accounts as of 31.12.2025:

Run TPM44 for key date 31.01.2026 after go-live, the log is as below:

Because of the configuration in 104457 ‚ÄúAssign Additional Update Types for Difference Procedure‚Äù, TPM44 includes DT_C011 into the accrual calculation, and results in the AD1004 business transaction 2,583.34 USD / 2,201.52 EUR, and a FX correction business transaction 6.21 EUR with update type AD1020. The blog Accrual: Reset Procedure and Difference Procedure explains the logic for difference method.

Illustrating the positions of balance sheet accounts and situations of profit and loss (P/L) accounts as of 31.01.2025 (incorporating results generated from TPM1 and TPM44).

Additional Notes

  • This blog only outlines certain posting patterns associated with legacy data transfer; such postings can vary based on specific business requirements.
  • You may always find more comprehensive information from help document Legacy Data Transfer.
  • Which DT_* update types are invoked for TPM63 is specified in configuration activity 106944 ‚ÄúAssign Update Types for Legacy Data Transfer‚Äù. Sample configuration:

  • App Mark Flows as Reversed - Legacy Data Transfer (app ID: TBB3) is used to reverse fixing done by TBB1_LC, just like TPM10 reverses TBB1.
  • App Reverse Initial Load of Position Values - Legacy Data Transfer (app ID: TPM64) is used to reverse results from TPM63.

entry.title: Billing plan details capturing issue against the contract item in SAP ECC
entry.content:
Hello All,

We have been facing an issue while processing the milestone billing against the contract item even we follow sequential process.

Config: 

1. we have enabled the billing plan at item category level and did the remain functional setup

Development the program with the below standard BAPIs/FMs

1. BAPI_CONTRACT_CREATEFROMDATA

2. BILLING_SCHEDULE_GENERATE

3.BILLING_SCHEDULE_GET_NUMBER

4.BILLING_SCHEDULE_SAVE  - Here we are trying to insert the billing plan details 

5.SD_SALES_DOCUMENT_SAVE

6.BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT

Outcome: The billing plan details aren't storing in the DB and can't be seen in VBKD,FPLA & FPLT etc.,

Note: We would appreciate any suggestions or inputs from your end.
